Issues.Body:
Updates dev-infra to the latest revision. This revision supports
for custom release prechecks and performs the release build
before the staging, verifying integrity later. This has various
benefits for stability and making the less less reluctant to build
issues that mess up a previously-merged staging PR.

Similar to #46291

Issues.Title: routerLink and attr.href work together
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

With both routerLink and attr.href attribute on, when routerLink set undefined (or null), the href attribute is not generated on the anchor DOM element.

```
<a
  [attr.href]="link"
  [routerLink]="routerNav ? link : undefined"
>
```

### Proposed solution

Even with routerLink set, do not block href attribute of the element.

### Alternatives considered

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "routerLink and attr.href work together" (#46284)

Issues.Title: @Output not working properly from global context even with ngzone.run()
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Description

If for `@Output` you create a callback in a global context (for example, as a property of a `window` object) and then try to emits events from this callback, only the first call will work. Further attempts to make emits will not work even with `ngzone.run()`.

You can see this bug on [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/github/KostyaTretyak/angular-global-output-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fchild.component.ts) or on [my repository](https://github.com/KostyaTretyak/angular-global-output-bug). If you try to click the "first" link and then the "second" link, everything will work as expected. But if you try to do it again, when you click on "second" you will not see the output message from the child `mesage from child @Output`.

In my case, I created several child components, each of which works with its vendor to login through social networks (Facebook, Google, etc.). These vendors call callbacks from a global context. In this case, I can't rely on using `@Output` because they don't work properly.

### Environment

```true
Angular CLI: 13.3.7
Node: 16.15.0
Package Manager: yarn 1.22.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 13.3.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1303.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.3.7
@angular-devkit/core            13.3.7
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.3.7
@angular/cli                    13.3.7
@schematics/angular             13.3.7
rxjs                            7.5.5
typescript                      4.6.4
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@Output not working properly from global context even with ngzone.run()" (#46288)

Issues.Title: docs: change wrong alerts to callouts
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [ ] Build related changes

- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A

In the aio docs there are some alerts with headers but alerts don't support headers (see the [docs style guide - alerts and callouts](https://angular.io/guide/docs-style-guide#alerts-and-callouts) section) and this just causes such headers to be wrongly rendered, as for example the [ModuleInjector one](https://angular.io/guide/hierarchical-dependency-injection#moduleinjector):

![Screenshot at 2022-06-05 17-49-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/172064263-3798b520-e2ff-44ed-9c18-3fb5b3fcfc13.png)


## What is the new behavior?

Such alerts have been converted to callouts so that the headers are not correctly rendered:

![Screenshot at 2022-06-05 19-02-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/172064343-c861b33c-e096-4464-b14a-eb1bb3c2dedb.png)


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
 - this is exactly the same as #46145 , then I thought that was a one thing so I did not check for other occurrences, this time around I've run a regex search so hopefully I got all them all :slightly_smiling_face: 
 - I needed to remove the code tags from the headers since they were rendered quite awkwardly (with a very low color contrast):
![Screenshot at 2022-06-05 18-59-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/172064459-330123c2-5e27-4f78-96e5-60fcc586fbc8.png)
(I did that in a separate fixup commit, so if you disagree I can easily drop that one)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs: change wrong alerts to callouts" (#46262)

Issues.Title: Content projection for templates
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? core ### Description [Content projection](https://angular.io/guide/content-projection) is an amazing feature, but it [has no elegant support](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51948301/using-ng-content-in-ng-template/) for `ng-template`. Such feature exists in many other template engines ( [Twig](https://twig.symfony.com/doc/3.x/tags/macro.html), [Jinja2](https://docs-python.ru/packages/modul-jinja2-python/takoe-makrosy-shablonov-jinja2/), [Nunjucks](https://mozilla.github.io/nunjucks/templating.html#macro) etc.) and very handy, as makes templates bit less verbose and allow to follow the [DRY](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don%27t_repeat_yourself) principle which increase overall productivity. Technically, such feature brings capability to operate with templates like with a [higher order functions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Higher-order_function), and allow to reuse and compose them pretty simple. ### Proposed solution ### Option 1: `` component ```html World ! Hello ``` ### Option 2: `*ngTemplateOutletContent` directive ```html World ! Hello ``` ### Option 3: Both component and direcive Option 2 prevent appearing of component related nodes in DOM and makes it more clean, but Option 1 semantics looks great. So would be nice to have both on developer choice. ### Proof of concept Proof of concept on [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ng-template-content?file=src%2Fmain.ts) for Angular 14. Proposed solution is based on top of [access to private fields](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ng-template-content?file=src%2Fng-macro%2Fng-macro.directive.ts) (see `getMacroTemplateContext` function), so required implementation on core level. ### Alternatives considered Technically [feature](https://stackoverflow.com/a/56958107/1543705) already supported by core. But on practice: - Implementation is not obvious and straightforward; - Html markup too verbose and destroy sematic; This makes feature usage too complicated or even not possible. For sure, components itself do the stuff excellent. But for complex components create additional components just to decrease local markup complexity - it's just brings an additional complexity to the whole application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Content projection for templates" (#46269)

Issues.Title: Support for pipes for events in template
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support for pipes for events in template" (#46264)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): update Angular peer dependencies to 14.0 stable
Issues.Body: Only stable versions are officially supported.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): update Angular peer dependencies to 14.0 stable" (#23314)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/pwa): add peer dependency on Angular CLI
Issues.Body: The peer dependency is needed so that the correct version that mathes the installed Angular CLI is installated.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/pwa): add peer dependency on Angular CLI" (#23307)

Issues.Title: test: use dynamic ports for e2e tests
Issues.Body: To allow concurrent tests on the same machine...
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test: use dynamic ports for e2e tests" (#23313)

Issues.Title: test: ensure legacy peer dependency mode for E2E snapshot tests
Issues.Body:
Snapshot builds may contain versions that are not yet released (e.g., RC phase main branch).
In this case peer dependency ranges may not resolve causing npm 7+ to fail during tests.
To support this case, legacy peer dependency mode is enabled for snapshot builds.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test: ensure legacy peer dependency mode for E2E snapshot tests" (#23311)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): ensure full process exit with older local CLI versions
Issues.Body:
Angular CLI versions prior to v14 may not exit correctly if not forcibly exited
via `process.exit`. When the local CLI version is less than v14, the CLI will now
use `process.exit` to ensure the process exits with these older CLI versions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): ensure full process exit with older local CLI versions" (#23298)

Issues.Title: Angular CLI 14: running `ng test --watch=false` on Angular 13 or 12 project does not end process when complete
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, globally installing Angular CLI 13 worked with both Angular 13 and Angular 12 projects when running `ng test --watch=false`. ### Description Installing Angular CLI 14 globally and running `ng test --watch=false` on an Angular 13 or Angular 12 application results in the process never terminating. This causes CI builds to hang indefinitely on any step that runs Angular unit tests using this command. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction - Run `npm i @angular/cli@13 -g` to Install Angular CLI 13. - Run `ng new` to create a new Angular application. I chose to add Angular routing and selected SCSS for the stylesheet format. Selecting SCSS seems to be required to reproduce the issue, but adding routing does not. - Run `ng test --watch=false` and observe the tests running, then the process terminating after completion. - Run `npm i @angular/cli@14 -g` to install Angular CLI 14. - Run `ng test --watch=false`. The message `Your global Angular CLI version (14.0.0) is greater than your local version (13.3.7). The local Angular CLI version is used.` will be displayed. Observe the tests running, then the process continuing to run even after the tests complete. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 
N/A
## 🌍 Your Environment macOS 12.4 node 14.17.6 npm 6.14.15 ### Global `ng version` 
Angular CLI: 14.0.0
Node: 14.17.6
Package Manager: npm 6.14.15 
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 
... 

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1400.0 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core         14.0.0 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics   14.0.0 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular          14.0.0 (cli-only)
### `ng version` inside application directory 
Angular CLI: 13.3.7
Node: 14.17.6
Package Manager: npm 6.14.15
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 13.3.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1303.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.3.7
@angular-devkit/core            13.3.7
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.3.7
@angular/cli                    13.3.7
@schematics/angular             13.3.7
rxjs                            7.5.5
typescript                      4.6.4
**Anything else relevant?** I was not able to reproduce the issue if I selected "CSS" instead of "SCSS" when creating the SPA.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular CLI 14: running `ng test --watch=false` on Angular 13 or 12 project does not end process when complete" (#23289)

Issues.Title: .angular-config.json not found in v14
Issues.Body:
Hi there, # 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 13.3.10 ### Description I have installed the new version (v14) of angular, generated a workspace with one app. Integrated the repo with gitlab pipeline, inside the pipeline when running the `ng build -c production` it fails due to `ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/nonexistent/.angular-config.json'`. After digging to find the existence of `.angular-config.json` I found it in `~/.angular-config.json` in my local machine. I deleted the mentioned file(from my machine), and run again the `ng build -c production` but it recreates again the file but first asks if I want to enable auto-completion and then it generates the file. ```json { "cli": { "analytics": false }, "version": 1 } ``` After downgrading the angular version to 13.3.10 the pipeline worked. And when running the build production command it does not generate the `.angular-config.json` file. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/nonexistent/.angular-config.json'.
## 🌍 Your Environment 

gitlab runner with node v14.
**Anything else relevant?** The build command generates the dist folder locally without the mentioned error.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".angular-config.json not found in v14" (#23310)

Issues.Title: ci: disable outdated Angular robot merge and triage behavior
Issues.Body:
The issue triage behavior is no longer used within this repository.
For the merge behavior, only the label status checks are potentially
beneficial but they are already checked via the `ng-dev` tooling
when merging.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: disable outdated Angular robot merge and triage behavior" (#23309)

Yes

I am about to migrate from v13 to v14, but I faced with the following issue. 
When I try to build library project it fails **on the first entry point which has reference to another entry** with the error:

Building entry point 'xxx'

I created a repo for this issue, [main](https://github.com/mgameover/app-n-lib/tree/main) branch contains working version (ng v13) and [ng-14](https://github.com/mgameover/app-n-lib/tree/ng-14) branch has the same code after `ng update @angular/core@14 @angular/cli@14` with the issue.

3. Update angular to v14 by  running `ng update @angular/core@14 @angular/cli@14`

Issues.Title: Allow custom option merging wrt multiple configurations
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->

# 🚀 Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

In one of the more recent releases, the capability was added to support multiple configurations via the `--configuration=a,b,c` switch.
Yet, if some of the configurations define the same properties, only last one will win (as explicitly mentioned in the documentation).
There have been several requests already culminating into [issue](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16688) demanding builtin merging capabilities (at least for some properties, eg `fileReplacements`). These were denied repeatedly.
With non-trivial projects, the given workarounds lead to unmaintainable configuration spaghetti, where it would be pretty simple to separate the individual configuration facets.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Therefore, in order to allow developers using angular-cli to manage their projects efficiently and allow Angular maintainers to not have to deal with merging logic, *I suggest adding a mechanism which allows the project developers to conduct the merging process in whatever fashion they fancy*. 
To achieve this, add an optional callback from [src](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/f6f37821c892fbe476e0879877415dbadef5e359/packages/angular_devkit/architect/node/node-modules-architect-host.ts#L182) that allows the project developers to apply whatever magic they deem necessary. This will allow the community to create plugins which will achieve the most common tasks.

Things needed:
- add configuration property to angular.json schema to reference the external merging function
- add callback invocation (if enabled) to the code where configuration options are decided on (see above)
- callback method should look like
  ```ts
  function angularConfigurationOptionCallback(activeConfigurationNames: string[], optionsLookup: Record<string, AngularCLIOptions>): AngularCLIOptions;
  ```
  where `activeConfigurationNames` is an array of currently enabled configrations, eg `--configuration=a,b,c -> ['a','b','c']`
  where `optionsLookup` is a lookup of all configuration options of angular.json mapped by their name

### Describe alternatives you've considered

- Hacking package.json install callbacks to monkey patch the angular-cli files in question (would need to track all minor updates for breaking changes).
- Using a surrounding build tool (maven, gradle, ..) to do the monkey patching
- Throw away the sophisticated configuration and use another build tool to prepare the workspace by assembling all conditional assets and file replacements beforehand
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow custom option merging wrt multiple configurations" (#23300)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): improve resilience of logging during process exit
Issues.Body:
In certain situations the existing console logger created via `@angular-devkit/core` `createConsoleLogger`
could try to write to a closed stdout pipe stream. This would result in an error during
execution. For cases such as the completion script command, this would also prevent the
command from functioning. To mitigate these cases, `createConsoleLogger` is no longer used
and instead a logger instance is directly created within the CLI that uses `Console.log`
and `Console.error` to write output. Exiting the CLI also now waits for messages to be
logged before proceeding with the exit.

Fixes #23288
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): improve resilience of logging during process exit" (#23296)

Yes, this worked in 13.2 ### Description My schematics unit tests are failing now, with an error: `ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'D:\src\fabric\node_modules\@schematics\angular\utility\test.js'` Looking at the package structure on disk, it has an `index.js` under `utility/test`, but the package.json is directing everything under utility to `./utility/*.js` ``` "exports": { "./package.json": "./package.json", "./utility": "./utility/index.js", "./utility/*": "./utility/*.js", "./migrations/migration-collection.json": "./migrations/migration-collection.json", "./*": "./*.js", "./private/components": "./private/components.js" }, ``` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8071845/171937353-92033f36-7ce7-40cc-b547-086fab8721f6.png) There is indeed no `test.js`. So either it'd either need a test.js emitted or exports updated to include `utility/test` ## 🔥 Exception or Error 

ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'D:\src\fabric\node_modules\@schematics\angular\utility\test.js'
## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 14.0.0
Node: 16.14.2
Package Manager: yarn 1.22.18
OS: win32 x64
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1400.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            14.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.0.0
@angular/flex-layout            13.0.0-beta.38
@schematics/angular             14.0.0
ng-packagr                      14.0.0
rxjs                            7.5.5
typescript                      4.7.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "v14: Error using modules in @schematics/angular/utility" (#23290)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): add text to help output to indicate that additional commands are available when ran in different context
Issues.Body: With this change we add a footer to indicate that more commands are available when running the CLI in a different context. Ie inside or outside of a workspace.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): add text to help output to indicate that additional commands are available when ran in different context" (#23283)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): during an update only use package manager force option with npm 7+
Issues.Body:
The package manager `--force` option is only relevant to npm 7+ wherein the option controls
the strictness of the npm 7+ peer dependency resolution. Yarn 2+ does not support a `--force`
option. When the `ng update` `--force` option was used, `ng update` was incorrectly
applying the package manager `--force` option to Yarn which lead to an installation failure.
This has now been corrected and the package manager `--force` option is now only applied to npm 7+.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): during an update only use package manager force option with npm 7+" (#23285)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove unneeded TypeScript transforms with esbuild
Issues.Body:
Only the `replaceBootstrap` TypeScript transform is needed with the `browser-esbuild` builder.
The `replaceBootstrap` transform converts the default generated JIT bootstrap call into an AOT
bootstrap call within an application. The other transforms were used to remove the development
and JIT related metadata from the AOT compiler generated code. However, with the esbuild based
build pipeline, these will be automatically removed without the need for additional transforms
via the earlier usage of the `ngJitMode` and `ngDevMode` defines.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove unneeded TypeScript transforms with esbuild" (#23286)

Issues.Title: bug(Bottom-sheet): The panelClass in Material bottom-sheet is not added to the <mat-bottom-sheet-container> in v14
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

13

### Description

The panelClass of config in Material bottom-sheet is not added to the class of tag "mat-bottom-sheet-container" but to it's parent tag "div" which class is cdk-overlay-pane.

Below are the demo that I set the panelClass valued "share-sheet".

▼ The bug of v14
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84447400/172362859-d2585e9d-96b8-4ecf-bb4b-20d02060494e.png)

▼ The previous version presented 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84447400/172363141-11e646b3-c50c-48d8-bf5f-0c3591bf970e.png)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  set the panelClass of configuration to the bottom sheet in component.
2. to check the code.


### Expected Behavior

The panelClass  is added to the class of  tag "mat-bottom-sheet-container".

### Actual Behavior

The panelClass  is not added to the class of tag "mat-bottom-sheet-container".
but to it's parent tag "div"

### Environment

- Angular: 14.0.0
- CDK/Material: 14.0.0
- Browser(s): chrome 102.0.5005.63
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Bottom-sheet): The panelClass in Material bottom-sheet is not added to the <mat-bottom-sheet-container> in v14" (#25033)

Issues.Title: feat(material/core): use strong focus indicators in high contrast mode
Issues.Body: Reuses the strong focus indicators styling for high-contrast mode users.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(material/core): use strong focus indicators in high contrast mode" (#25038)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): add i18n strings
Issues.Body:
Add i18n strings for "Start Date" and "End Date". Add `formatYearRangeLabel` to format a year of
dates in a screen reader friendly way (e.g. "2019 to 2020"). The existing method, `formatYearRange`,
uses a dash character which does not read well on screen readers.

These three new strings are not used in this commit. They will be used in future commits as aria
labels and descriptions to fix accessibility bugs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/datepicker): add i18n strings" (#25024)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Typography): Defining a Level
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

In the [Typography Guide](https://material.angular.io/guide/typography) there's this section.

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-config Sass function. This function accepts, in order, CSS values for font-size, line-height, font-weight, font-family, and letter-spacing. You can also specify the parameters by name, as demonstrated in the example below.

@use '@angular/material' as mat;

$my-custom-level: mat.define-typography-level(
  $font-family: Roboto,
  $font-weight: 400,
  $font-size: 1rem,
  $line-height: 1,
  $letter-spacing: normal,
);
```

Instead of.:

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-config Sass function. 
```

It should be

```
You can define a typography level with the define-typography-level Sass function. ```
```

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/typography
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Typography): Defining a Level" (#25030)

Issues.Title: feat(GoogleMap): Expose map for use with other apis
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I have a map loaded on my screen, but I also want to use the Places Api. Although geocoding is supported by the library, places is not.

The map, and map instance, are created solely through my template
```
        <google-map [options]="options" class="col-sm-8">
            <map-marker
                [options]="markerOptions"
                [position]="markerPosition"
            ></map-marker>
        </google-map>
```

I have been trying the following code

```
        const map1: any = document.querySelector("google-map") as unknown;
        console.log("lookup", map1)

        const map2: GoogleMap = map1;
        var request = {
            query: 'albina',
            fields: ['name', 'geometry'],
        };
        var service = new google.maps.places.PlacesService(map2);
        service.findPlaceFromQuery(request, (results, status) => console.log(results, status))
```

This works in javascript - the querySelector returns the dom node, but it can be passed successfully to `PlacesService`. As I am using typescript I keep being told that I can't pass an html element (not withstanding my attempts to override the type).

Really what I want is to access the map as is, rather than using dom lookups, but I cannot work out how to access that. As you can see, I am able to create and pass options to the component, but don't know angular well enough to get the map back


### Use Case

I also want to use the Places Api which requires me to pass a google map. the obvious candidate is the one created by this component, but I cannot see how to access it
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(GoogleMap): Expose map for use with other apis" (#25026)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop): Not working with web component
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I created a web component from an Angular component with the function: `createCustomElement`.

This component can receive draggable elements. However the drag and drop doesn't seem to be common between a web component and an angular component


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
Drag an element from the Angular component section to web component section

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-drag-and-drop-example-z3dzqg

### Expected Behavior

Drag and drop must work between the web component and the angular components.

### Actual Behavior

Drag and drop does not work between the web component and the angular component.

It is impossible to drop an element from the web component to the element list of the angular component or vice versa

### Environment

- Angular: `13.1.0`
- CDK/Material: `13.1.0`
- elements: `13.1.0`
- Browser(s): `Chrome 102.0.5005.61`
- Operating System: `macOS`

Issues.Title: bug(Datepicker): Hidden calendar button not in the selected language
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was



### Description

When the locale changes for the datepicker, the calendar switch to the appropriate language. But the hidden 'Close calendar' button stay in english. This is an issue for accessibility, especially for reader application.


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/106828605/171902517-d7db98f8-daf5-4fad-a594-7e7a7bd7412d.png)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Change locale to French
2. Open the Datepicker
3. Press 'TAB' until the hidden button appear


### Expected Behavior

The label and content of the button should be in the language specified by the locale.

### Actual Behavior

The hidden button stay in english

### Environment

- Angular: 11+
- CDK/Material: Datepicker
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Datepicker): Hidden calendar button not in the selected language" (#25021)

Issues.Title: bug(MatDialog): Mouse press outside of dialog enables backwards navigation and interacting outside of the dialog
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When a dialog is displayed I expect that the user should not be able to interact with the UI behind the dialog. But this is possible by using the keyboard while the mouse is pressed down.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview
2. Open a dialog in any of the examples
3. Press down left mouse button outside of the dialog (keep it pressed down)
4. Press shift + tab

### Expected Behavior

It navigates in the dialog.

### Actual Behavior

It navigates outside of the dialog.
As long as the mouse is pressed down the user will be able to continue navigating and even interact with elements behind the dialog

### Environment

- Angular: 13.3.8
- CDK/Material: 13.3.8
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatDialog): Mouse press outside of dialog enables backwards navigation and interacting outside of the dialog" (#25009)
